** Dinobot's expression turned towards that of slight disappointment as the 
Alliance disengaged and disappeared to head back towards their impenetrable 
island. He had looked forward to getting into another battle with them once 
again, even though he was damaged and in need of repair. But war had always 
come before personal safety.
He uncrossed his arms and glanced towards the movement of Maximals leaving 
the area and returning to the Cybertronain Fire, yet not going to join them. 
He could repair on his own and was in no need to too much Maximal company, 
which would result in entering the damaged battlebase.
Besides, he had grown uncomfortable with simply standing with others he 
could care less if were led like lambs to the slaughter into the waiting 
mouth of the enemy.
Dinobot shifted his weight slightly before converting into Beast Mode, 
shaking himself to be rid of any dust that would be uncomfortable in any 
gears it might get into. He glanced towards Tavatron and thought if she 
would follow the others into the base, since she was in need of repair. To 
do so himself would save time but be too painful, so that was not an option. 
But whether or not she entered the Cybertronian Fire with the remainder of 
the Maximals was her choice, though he would not stay. It would be no hassle 
for her to locate him after her repairs, so leaving would be no deal worth 
fussing over.
He was no Maximal and had no place here, besides, he wished time to think 
and a quite place would be more attractive to that need then a charred 
field. Even though he knew that the battlefield was where he belonged.
Dinobot only kept his eyes on Tavatron for a moment or so before turning his 
snout towards the far distant mountains, where a silent place was waiting 
for him to ponder in. Even if it was the murky depths of a moss covered 
swamp.
Growling, he took a step in that direction but before he could create a 
second footfall he was suddenly stunned by enemies impact which had collided 
with the flat of his snout. At first his mind reeled with confusion, knocked 
blank the second, whatever it was, had struck him. But as soon as his 
thoughts began to form logical conclusions the first, which entered his 
mind, was a stray attack from an enemy, which had found its mark. Or perhaps 
some wise cracking bot had snack up upon him and whacked something hard on 
the top of his snout. But the second his mind formed enough thought to 
suggest a look he spotted something rather...rather black and fuzzy which 
sat exactly where the impact had been.
Dinobot had no idea just what to think of such an event, though it was the 
first of it's like which had occurred to him. It had been a shock if nothing 
else, and as to recover what dignity was lost by such an event he growled 
and shook his head to rid himself of such a fuzzy pest.
Whether it was alive or not was any of his concern, just as long as it came 
off!**
